section.label: Disk configuration
section.comment: boot_device designates the device where the JumpStart program is to install the root (/) file system and the system's boot device.
bootenv createbe enables you to create an empty-and-inactive boot environment at the same time you are installing the operating environment.
dontuse designates one or more disks that you do not want the JumpStart program to use.
fdisk defines how the fdisk partitions are set up on an x86 based system.
By using filesys with the listed values, the JumpStart program sets up the installed system to automatically mount remote file systems when the system boots.

option.label: Mounting Remote File Systems A MULTIPLIER
option.name: filesys

section.comment: The metadb keyword enables you to create Solaris Volume Manager state database replicas (metadbs) during your custom JumpStart installation.
partitioning defines how the disks are divided into slices for file systems during the installation.

option.label: Enter the type of partitioning you want
option.name: partitioning

section.comment: Choose a custom root device slice.
The usedisk profile keyword designates one or more disks that you want the JumpStart program to use. You must specify disk_name in the form cxtydz or cydz, for example, c0t0d0 or c0d0s0.

option.label: Enter the disk you want to use
option.name: usedisk

section.label: Locale configuration
section.comment: geo designates the regional locale or locales that you want to install .

section.comment: locale designates the locale packages you want to install or add when upgrading for the specified locale_name.

section.label: Software configuration
section.comment: cluster designates the software group to add to the system

choice.label: Entire Solaris Software Group Plus OEM Support

section.comment: package designates whether a package is to be added to or deleted from the software group that is to be installed on the system. syntax : package_name [add [retrieval_type location]| delete]

option.label: Enter the name of the package to install
option.name: package

section.comment: add a patch during installation . syntax : patch_id_list | patch_file patch_location optional_keywords]

option.label: Enter the name of the patch
option.name: patch

section.label: Diskless client configuration
section.comment: num_clients defines the number of diskless clients, client_num, that a server supports.
client_arch specifies that the operating system server is to support a different platform group than the server uses.
client_root defines the amount of root space, root_size in Mbytes, to allocate for each client.
client_swap defines the amount of swap space, swap_size in Mbytes, to allocate for each diskless client.

section.label: Architecture configuration
section.comment: system_type defines the type of system on which the Solaris OS is to be installed.

option.label: Choose if system is standalone or a server
option.name: system_type

section.label: File Location
section.comment: Set the location where the Solaris Flash archive is stored.
